item.title: Melissa add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "But my body was like a harp and her words and gestures were like fingers running upon the wires." -- James Joyce

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Melissa add a quote by virginia woolf
item.description: "As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world." -- virginia woolf

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Judith Butler
item.description: "Whether or not we continue to enforce a universal conception of human rights at moments of outrage and incomprehension, precisely when we think that others have taken themselves out of the human community as we know it, is a test of our very humanity." -- Judith Butler

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Melissa add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "One is happy as a result of one's own efforts once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness: simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self denial to a point, love of work, and above all, a clear conscience." -- George Sand

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Writing a novel is a terrible experience, during which the hair often falls out and the teeth decay. I'm always irritated by people who imply that writing fiction is an escape from reality. It is a plunge into reality and it's very shocking to the system." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. " -- Mae West

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often." -- Mae West

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Melissa add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Before I go on with this short history, let me make a general observation– the test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function. One should, for example, be able to see that things are hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise. This philosophy fitted on to my early adult life, when I saw the improbable, the implausible, often the "impossible," come true." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Melissa add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Good writing is supposed to evoke sensation in the reader—not the fact that it is raining, but the feeling of being rained upon." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
Melissa add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "Freedom is participation in power." -- Cicero

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Do stuff. be clenched, curious. Not waiting for inspiration's shove or society's kiss on your forehead. Pay attention. It's all about paying attention. attention is vitality. It connects you with others. It makes you eager. stay eager." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Judith Butler
item.description: "...gender is a kind of imitation for which there is no original; in fact, it is a kind of imitation that produces the very notion of the original as an effect and consequence of the imitation itself...what they imitate is a phantasmic ideal of heterosexual identity...gay identities work neither to copy nor emulate heterosexuality, but rather, to expose heterosexuality as an incessant and panicked imitation of its own naturalized idealization. That heterosexuality is always in the act of elaborating itself is evidence that it is perpetually at risk, that it, that it 'knows' it's own possibility of becoming undone" -- Judith Butler

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Was everyone else really as alive as she was?...If the answer was yes, then the world, the social world, was unbearably complicated, with two billion voices, and everyone's thoughts striving in equal importance and everyone's claim on life as intense, and everyone thinking they were unique, when no one was." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Rainer Rilke
item.description: "Go into yourself and test the deeps in which your life takes rise; at its source you will find the answer to the question whether you must create. Accept it, just as it sounds, without inquiring into it. Perhaps it will turn out that you are called to be an artist. Then take that destiny upon yourself and bear it, its burden and its greatness, without ever asking what reward might come from outside" -- Rainer Rilke

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Rainer Marie Rilke
item.description: "Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always." -- Rainer Marie Rilke
